means: 随意的，任性的，随心所欲的
霸道的，专制的，专横的，独断独行的

sentence.Network_en: The choice of players for the team seemed completely arbitrary.
sentence.Network_cn: 看来这个队的队员完全是随意选定的。

sentence.Network_en: A good judge does not make arbitrary decisions.
sentence.Network_cn: 一个优秀的法官不会作武断的判决.

sentence.Network_en: You can make an arbitrary choice.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English  (in the sense 'dependent on one's will or pleasure, discretionary'): from Latin arbitrarius, from arbiter 'judge, supreme ruler', perhaps influenced by French arbitraire

entry.tran: 武断的;任意的;任性的;主观的
entry.def: If you describe an action, rule, or decision as arbitrary, you think that it is not based on any principle, plan, or system. It often seems unfair because of this.

example.ex: Arbitrary arrests and detention without trial were common.
example.tran: 随意逮捕和拘留屡见不鲜。

means.word_mean: 1. based on or subject to individual discretion or preference or sometimes impulse or caprice;

sentences.sentence: "arbitrary division of the group into halves"

auth_sentence.content: Now I have an arbitrary e-mail message come in.

auth_sentence.content: Precisely following arbitrary rules is no guarantee of that.

auth_sentence.content: By definition, by fiat, by arbitrary declaration.

means.word_mean: (行动、决定、规章等）任意的；武断的；随心所欲的

sentences.en: You can make an arbitrary choice.

jushi.english: You can make an arbitrary choice.

jushi.chinese: 他做的决定难以预料，主观武断。

jushi.english: It is difficult to discern the motive of this seemingly arbitrary attack.
jushi.chinese: 这种看上去随心所欲的攻击很难看出其动机。
